trans-unit.source: Defines an attribute that is used by ASP.NET server controls to indicate at design time whether nested content that is contained within a server control corresponds to controls or to properties of the server control.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute> is used in combination with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> to determine how nested content of a control is interpreted.

If <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute> is `true` and <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> is `false`, the nested content contained within an ASP.NET server control is persisted as controls.
If <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute> is `false` and <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> is `true`, the nested content is persisted as properties of the server control.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/30386922-1e00-4602-9ebf-526b271a8b87).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref> class using a Boolean value indicating whether to persist nested content as nested controls.
`true` to persist the nested content as nested controls; otherwise, `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref> class using two Boolean values.
One indicating whether to persist nested content as nested controls and the other indicating whether to use a custom persistence method.
`true` to persist nested content as nested controls; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to use customized persistence; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates the default attribute state.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute.Default"></xref> field is read-only.
The default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute.Default> field is `Yes`, indicating that nested content is persisted at design time.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
The object to compare with the current object.
`true` if obj is equal to the current object; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref> class.
A hash code for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether the value of the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref> class is the default value of the derived clss.
`true` if the value of the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute"></xref> is the default instance; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates that nested content should not persist as nested controls at design time.
This field is read-only.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute.No> field is called, the inner content of a server control is persisted as properties, not as server.
Gets a value that indicates whether the nested content is persisted as nested controls at design time.
`true` to persist nested content as nested controls; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets a value indicating whether the server control provides custom persistence of nested controls at design time.
To configure nested content for custom persistence, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute> overload that takes a `usesCustomPersistence` parameter.
`true` to provide custom persistence of nested content; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Indicates that nested content should persist as controls at design time.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute.Yes"></xref> field is read-only.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistChildrenAttribute.Yes> field is called, nested content is persisted as controls.
